effect: A dust devil picks up the caster and moves them uncontrollably 60 feet in a random direction.
The target grows wings granting it a fly Speed equal to its land Speed for 1 minute. If it already had a fly Speed, it instead gains a +30-foot status bonus to its fly Speed for 1 minute.
For 1 minute, the caster can Leap 30 feet horizontally and 15 feet vertically with bursts of air. The caster can choose to Leap when the effect occurs.
A 60-foot line directed from the caster to the target is affected by gust of wind.
The caster is affected by the shrink spell for 1 hour, becoming Tiny.
The target grows a muscular physique, gaining a +2 status bonus on Athletics checks, Strength-based attack rolls, and Strength-based damage rolls for 10 minutes.
The caster is affected by a 4th-rank enlarge for 1 minute, becoming Huge.
Different parts of the target’s body warp and grow asymmetrically, making them clumsy 2 for 1 minute.
The caster is blinded for 1 minute, as the world around them fades away leaving nothing but darkness in their sight.

The target is surrounded in a shroud of supernatural darkness with a 10-foot emanation for 1 minute; darkvision can’t see through this darkness but the target can (regardless of its vision) and greater darkvision can as well.
The caster gains greater darkvision for 1 minute.
The target loses any darkvision or greater darkvision it has for 1 hour if it fails a Fortitude save.
The caster’s life force is leached away and they’re drained 2.

The target’s attacks are devastatingly lethal. For 1 minute, all their attacks and abilities gain the death trait and can’t be nonlethal. Additionally, their unarmed attacks gain the deadly d8 trait, unless they already had the deadly trait with a larger die.

The caster is protected by a grim veil of void energy. For 1 minute, the caster gains resistance equal to three times the spell rank to void damage and a +4 status bonus to saving throws against void and death effects.
The target is condemned to die by the reaper’s scythe. After 3 rounds, the target takes 2d12 void damage per spell rank with a basic Fortitude save. This is a death effect.
The caster is knocked prone by ongoing tremors, and can only Stand as a two-action activity. They cannot use Kip Up or similar feats to Stand.
The target is protected by a rock shield. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC for 1 minute. If the target takes a critical hit before then, the shield is destroyed.
The caster’s body becomes as tough as stone. The caster gains resistance to all physical damage except adamantine equal to twice the spell rank for 1 minute.
Tremors in a 20-foot emanation around the target cause all creatures on the ground in the area to become knocked prone unless they succeed at a Reflex save.
The caster becomes electrically polarized, drawing metal weapons toward them. For 10 minutes, all attacks with metal weapons and electricity effects gain a +1 circumstance bonus against the caster.
The target’s melee attacks arc like lightning to an additional target for 1 minute, dealing half the Strike’s normal damage as electricity damage.
The caster is surrounded by an electric field. Adjacent creatures that hit the caster take electricity damage equal to the spell’s rank and become shocked for 1 round.
A lightning bolt strikes in a line between the caster and the target, damaging all creatures in the line except the caster.
The caster spontaneously combusts, suffering 1d4 persistent fire damage per spell rank.
The target’s melee attacks cause explosions for 1 minute, dealing an amount of fire splash damage on a successful attack equal to the spell’s rank.
The caster is surrounded by blue flame, with the effects of fire shield of rank 4 or the spell’s rank, whichever is higher.
A fireball is centered on the target.
For 1 minute, all of the caster’s movements deal force damage equal to 1/5th the distance traveled in feet.
For 1 minute, the target’s melee attacks also reposition the attacked creature 5 feet due to threads of force.
For 1 minute, the caster gains a force field protecting them from harm. The force field has 10 Hit Points per spell rank.
The target becomes attached to the caster by strings of force unless it succeeds at a Fortitude save.
The caster is frozen in ice, taking a –30-foot status penalty to Speeds for 1 minute but gaining +2 AC.
The target’s melee attacks freeze all they strike for 1 minute, reducing target Speed cumulatively.
A dreary cloud appears above the caster’s head, swirling flurries of snow in a 5-foot emanation for 1 minute.
The target is surrounded in a 3-action howling blizzard of the spell’s rank.
For 10 minutes, whenever an effect causes the caster to recover Hit Points, they recover half as many as normal.
The target’s wounds are instantly healed, affected by a two-action heal of the spell’s rank.
The caster gains a swirling buffer of life energy, granting them 6 temporary Hit Points per spell rank for 1 minute.
Horrific cancers, cysts, and polyps grow all over the target’s body, causing sickness depending on a Fortitude save.
For 10 minutes, the caster is surrounded in a halo of light that makes them look like a saint or angel but forces them to tell the truth.
Light bends around the target, granting it the effects of a 2nd-rank invisibility.
For 1 minute, the caster’s eyes shine with rainbow colors, allowing them to see invisible creatures and counteract illusions.
For 1 minute, strobing lights surround the target, causing them to be dazzled.
For 1 hour, the caster’s backpack and pouches fill with random junk, making them encumbered.
For 1 minute, all of the target’s Strikes deal 1 additional damage die and count as adamantine, cold iron, silver, and orichalcum.
The caster’s body transforms into a metallic version of their normal body for 1 minute, gaining AC bonuses but becoming heavy.
An enormous sword falls from the sky and impales the target, dealing 2d8 piercing damage per spell rank with a basic Reflex save.
The caster’s thoughts appear around them as floating words and images visible to everyone else.
The target’s mind swells with powerful resolve, gaining +2 status bonus to attack rolls, saves, and skill checks for 1 minute.
The caster sees mysterious images that grant subtle clues about a problem or mystery.
The target begins giggling uncontrollably and is stupefied 2 for 1 minute.
The caster is accompanied by loud theme music for 1 hour.
The target becomes absolutely silent for 1 minute unless they choose to make a sound.
A victorious fanfare plays from the caster for 1 minute, granting +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls to allies.
The target dances to a jig only it can hear. For 1 minute, it becomes off-guard when it moves and moves at half Speed.
The magic through the caster’s body transforms into venom; they are afflicted by stage 1 wyvern venom.
The target’s unarmed attacks deal persistent poison (or acid) damage for 1 minute.
The caster is purged by medicinal toxins, removing one random affliction (cleanse affliction of rank 2 or spell rank).
The target is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.
The caster and the target switch locations.
For 1 minute, the target can teleport to any location reachable by a single action of their normal movement Speeds.
The caster is affected by flicker of 4th rank or the spell’s rank, whichever is higher.
The target is teleported 1 mile away in a random direction unless it succeeds on a Will save; this is an incapacitation effect.
The caster’s spirit leaves their body for 1d4 rounds but can continue to cast spells.
The target becomes quasi-corporeal for 1 minute, gaining resistance equal to the spell’s rank to all damage except force, spirit, or void.
The caster gains a sixth sense for spiritual beings for 10 minutes.
The target suffers 2d6 spirit damage per spell rank with a basic Fortitude save.
The caster vanishes and reappears in 1d4 rounds as they jump forward in time.
The target gains a glimpse of the future, allowing them to roll one attack, save, or skill check twice and take the better result.
The caster sees visions of possible futures involving themselves and their allies.
The target is slowed, as by the slow spell.
The caster is pushed 20 feet by a hydraulic push from a random direction.
The target can swim through the air for 1 minute.
The caster is surrounded by a bubble of water for 1 minute granting resistances to acid and fire.
A giant wave carries the caster through a line past the target’s space, dealing 2d6 bludgeoning damage per spell rank.
Vines and plants grow around the caster’s feet, making terrain difficult for them for 1 minute.
The target grows leaves and can heal by basking in sunlight for 10 minutes.
A tree grows in a random unoccupied 5-foot square adjacent to the caster.
The plants in an area around the target come to life, creating an entangling aura.
The caster switches voices with the target.
The target and caster switch bodies cosmetically for 1 minute.
A rainbow changes the caster’s coloration to bright colors for 1 day.
Space distorts in a 30-foot emanation around the target for 1 minute, shortening diagonal distances.
Whenever the caster speaks, words emerge as rainbow-colored bubbles for 1 minute.
For 1 hour, the target sees every creature as identical to themselves.
The caster reverts to their child form for 1 hour, possibly changing size category.
The target explodes harmlessly every 1d4 rounds with light and confetti for 10 minutes.
The caster falls in love with the target for 1 hour (as charm critical failure).
The target becomes paranoid that everything around them is an adversary in disguise for 1 hour.
The caster’s outfit changes to a bizarre or embarrassing style for 1 day.
For 1 day, the target must speak in pompous and archaic language.
The caster reveals their deepest desire and continues blurting embarrassing secrets for 1 minute.
For 1 hour, the target leaves behind a colorful trail of spectral flower petals.
For 1 day, the caster sees all sapient creatures as talking animals, and talking animals as plant creatures.
For 1 hour, the target is followed by a spotlight like in a stage play, changing colors by mood.
The caster transforms cosmetically to look like the being they most admire for 1 day.
The target smells strongly of cinnamon for 1 day, making them easier to track by scent.
The caster talks in rhyming couplets for 1 day.
The spell works normally with double the range, area, and duration. If not a spell, the caster may select a spell they know of that rank or lower.
